text.section:
If a financier becomes a licensee in connection with its financial accommodation contract and then transfers its contractual interest under the license, or sublicenses the licensed computer information or informational rights, to a licensee receiving the financial accommodation, the following rules apply:
The transfer or sublicense to the accommodated licensee is not effective unless:
The transfer or sublicense is effective under § 22-503 of this subtitle; or
The following conditions are fulfilled:
A financier that makes a transfer that is effective under subparagraph (1)(B) of this paragraph may make only the single transfer or sublicense contemplated by the notice unless the licensor consents to a later transfer.

If a financier makes an effective transfer of its contractual interest in a license, or an effective sublicense of the licensed information or informational rights, to an accommodated licensee, the following rules apply:
The accommodated licensee's rights and obligations are governed by:
The license;
Any rights of the licensor under other law; and
To the extent not inconsistent with subparagraphs (A) and (B) of this paragraph, the financial accommodation contract, which may impose additional conditions to the licensee's right to use the licensed information or informational rights.
The financier does not make warranties to the accommodated licensee other than the warranty under § 22-401(b)(1) of this title and any express warranties in the financial accommodation contract.
